page.title: 18ANGLICAN CHURCH: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: Holy Trinity Church, of Norman origin, is centrally placed in Church Street, the main thoroughfare. It also lies immediately below 1 of the ancient banks which comes off the scarp face of Marleycombe Hill, where there is evidence of an early Settlement. The Church was restored & further height added to the tower in 1860. It has 3 bells rung for Services & a good striking clock wound twice weekly. Services are conducted by a Vicar with assistance, as he is responsible for 6 Churches - the Western Benefice of the Chalke Valley Group. The Services are attended by up to 50 people, especially the Family Service, when 15 children may be present. Women assist & the 4th Sunday Service is organised locally. Weddings, Baptisms & Confirm- ations take place. Burials in the graveyard are for all denominations.
